Sentencas: In this study, Ce0.89+xGd0.1-2xSrxEu0.01O2-delta (x = 0-0.04) ceramic electrolytes sintered at different temperatures were prepared and the impurity scavenging effect of Sr(2+ )dopants on their grain boundary (GB) electrical properties were investigated.
Titulo: Insight into impurity scavenging effect of gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes

Sentencas: The phase compositions, microstructures, and ionic conductivities of the samples were investigated using X-ray diffraction, scanning electron microscopy, and AC impedance spectroscopy, respectively.
Titulo: Insight into impurity scavenging effect of gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes

Sentencas: The incorporation of Sr2+ improved the overall GB conduction of the electrolytes by decreasing their GB area and space-charge potential.
Titulo: Insight into impurity scavenging effect of gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes

Sentencas: It hindered conduction to some extent by weakening the impurity dilution effect.
Titulo: Insight into impurity scavenging effect of gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes

Sentencas: The scavenging effect could be observed only when the sintering temperature was higher than the eutectic temperature of Si GB impurities.
Titulo: Insight into impurity scavenging effect of gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes

Sentencas: At low sintering temperatures, the Sr2+ dopants could not scavenge the GB impurities and increased the GB impurity coverage proportion.
Titulo: Insight into impurity scavenging effect of gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes

Sentencas: The findings of this study provide insights into the optimisation of the GB electrical properties of oxygen-ion conductors by selecting appropriate dopants and sintering temperatures to induce the GB impurity scavenging effect.
Titulo: Insight into impurity scavenging effect of gadolinium-doped ceria electrolytes
